item.title: Avtech Scientific releases the source code of ASL to the community.
item.description:
Avtech Scientific announces the first open source release of its Advanced Simulation Library. The software will be distributed under the free GNU Affero General Public License (AGPL) with an optional commercial license. The company hopes that this step will encourage collaboration with the user community accelerating the extension of ASL and lead to sustaining of its high quality standards.

Advanced Simulation Library is a free and open source multiphysics simulation software package. Its computational engine is based, among others, on the Lattice Boltzmann methods and is written in OpenCL which enable extraordinarily efficient deployment on a variety of massively parallel architectures, ranging from inexpensive FPGAs, DSPs and GPUs up to heterogeneous clusters and supercomputers. The engine is hidden entirely behind C++ classes, so that no OpenCL knowledge is required from programmers. ASL can be utilized to model various coupled physical and chemical phenomena, especially in the field of CFD. Its application fields are immensely wide: from virtual sensing (embedded systems for modeling-based monitoring and control of industrial processes, when hardware sensors are unavailable, unsuitable or do not provide sufficient information), simulation-based surgery planning and guidance to computer-aided engineering and high-performance scientific computing.
